content.raw:
The new visuals looks great, but we have to address mismatches with existing collision shapes.

Pros:

  1.  New visuals better represents the actual hardware.
  1.  New visuals look (much) better.

Cons:

  1.  Using new visuals without changing the corresponding collision geometries can result in large visual interpenetration between Atlas robot and surrounding objects.  (The mismatches between new visuals and old collisions can be seen in the attached files).  This might also throw off 3D sensors when the robot tries to see itself.
  1.  If changes were made to the collision geometries to match the new visuals, given the short time frame to actual VRC, we might disrupt existing workflow or interfere with existing solution techniques that teams have been developing.

We should do one or some of below:

 1. Use the new visuals with old collisions and tolerate visual mesh interpenetrations.
 1. Update collision geometries to better match visuals, i.e.:
    a. change `lleg` collision geometries (see attached).
    a. add head shroud (protective cage) collision geometries.
    a. use a cage-less version of the `utorso` mesh (see attached).
    a. change `pelvis` collision geometries to match new visual with the new "tripod" pelvis.
    a. change all the arm collision geometries to match those of the new visuals.
